title:
Impact of ALD-Deposited Ultrathin Nitride Layers on Carrier Lifetimes
  and Photoluminescence Efficiency in CdTe/MgCdTe Double Heterostructures
authors:
Haris Naeem Abbasi, Xin Qi, Zheng Ju, Zhenqiang Ma, and Yong-Hang
  Zhang
abstract:
This work evaluates the passivation effectiveness of ultrathin nitride layers
(SiNx, AlN, TiN) deposited via atomic layer deposition on CdTe/MgCdTe double
heterostructures for solar cell applications. Time-resolved photoluminescence
and photoluminescence measurements revealed enhanced carrier lifetimes and
reduced surface recombination, indicating improved passivation effectiveness.
These results underscore the potential of SiNx as a promising passivation
material to improve the efficiency of CdTe solar cells.
